Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Prehabilitation vs. Rehabilitation in Frail Patients Undergoing Colorectal Cancer Resection

Trial_Design.evidence: single-blind, parallel-arm, superiority randomized clinical trial

Participants.evidence: frail patients (Fried Frailty Index ≥ 2) aged 65 years or older undergoing colorectal cancer resection

Intervention.evidence: The intervention was a multimodal program involving exercise, nutritional, and psychological components initiated before (Prehab) or after (Rehab) surgery.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the impact of a prehabilitation program on 30-day postoperative complications in frail patients compared to postoperative rehabilitation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the Comprehensive Complications Index at 30 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 120 patients were randomized, with 110 included in the intention-to-treat analysis (55 in each group).

Number_Analysed.evidence: 110 included in the intention-to-treat analysis (55 in each group).

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant difference was found in the primary outcome (adjusted mean difference, –3.2; 95% CI, –11.8 to 5.3; P = .45).
